metadata.titel_preek: Lent and Holy Week: Ash Wednesday & First Sunday in Lent

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the human condition of universal sin and self-deception to justify the ungodly through the substitutionary death of Christ.

subject.identificatie: God (specifically in the person of Jesus Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has shown us a great thing.
Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
make a completely new person out of the sinner

zender.identificatie: The Holy God / The Author of all goodness
tekstueel_bewijs: the reality of God, the power of God, the holiness of God
While we were still sinners, Christ died for us
the salvation of each and every one of us
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly positioned as the Receiver/Beneficiary, not the Subject.

tekstueel_bewijs: There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself
helper.rol_van_god: God is both Subject (Initiator) and Helper (Incarnate Son).
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicit as the one who enables the 'insight' of repentance.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the 'Charade' of Self-Righteousness
tekstueel_bewijs: an exhausting, lifelong charade of pretense
the storm of the wrath of God against sin
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is treated as a theological reality that requires a divine death to nullify, not just a moral mistake.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having received grace, now sees themselves and others truthfully (Repentance as Insight).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The knowledge of grace precedes and enables the confession of sin and the cessation of the 'charade'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: God → New Creation of the Sinner

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has shown us a great thing.
He has wrought the salvation of his enemies.
God sees you as you really are, and he loves you.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We do not need to surround ourselves with defenses.
The psalmist demonstrated that he has learned to see sin as God sees it.

voorbeelden: The person who confesses sin in this free way...
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.
God is truly able to do away with sin.
let each one find thee mighty to save.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes God's 'ability' (Power) to save where the human 'ability' is non-existent. Repentance is framed as a 'knowing' (Savoir) that is a gift of grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Judgment) to ~S1 (Pretense) to S1 (Grace) via Christ taking the S2 position.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies the position of the 'Enemy' (S2) to transfer the 'Enemy' to the position of 'Righteousness' (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'storm of wrath' is explicitly mentioned as something Christ bore.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is rigorously theocentric. Human action (repentance) is described as a 'response' to a prior divine action. God is the primary actor in the salvation event.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The psalmist demonstrated that he has learned to see sin as God sees it.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is Another who has taken the sentence upon himself.
The knowledge of grace has preceded the confession of sin.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (David, Paul) are used as witnesses to the human condition or God's character, not as moral templates to imitate by will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: the Psalmist is a 'person who knows there is mercy'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'exhausting charade'; psychological security in being 'known and loved'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Justification is extra nos (outside of ourselves).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'insight' of sin to the 'act' of Christ is seamless and logically follows theocentric premises.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus, the Son of God, has voluntarily taken our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is mentioned in the prayer as the one who 'creates and makes in us new hearts', suggesting an endowment of competence.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is 'directed against God' and incurs 'wrath'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is never asked to perform the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of salvation.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon avoids the 'Devoir' (Must) trap effectively.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented homiletics. It uses the 'Subject-Switch' to move the burden of performance from the hearer to Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of Tolkien/Solzhenitsyn as 'illustrations', Greimassian analysis shows they function as 'Helpers' to the 'Savoir' (Knowledge) of the human condition.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Psalm 51; this analysis reveals the functional role of the 'Psalmist' as a proxy for the 'Receiver'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Exposes that 'Repentance' is not a work the Subject does to get the Object, but a state of the Receiver once the Object (Grace) is promised.

appendices.notities: The sermon consistently avoids the 'If-Then' conditional structure of moralism.
